solution_line_template: If each bulb uses {watts_per_bulb_per_day} watts each day, the {num_bulbs} bulbs that Allyn has uses {watts_per_bulb_per_day}*{num_bulbs} = <<{watts_per_bulb_per_day}*{num_bulbs}={total_watts_per_day}>>{total_watts_per_day} watts of power each day.
In June, with {days_in_june} days, the bulbs will use {days_in_june}*{total_watts_per_day} = <<{days_in_june}*{total_watts_per_day}={total_watts_in_june}>>{total_watts_in_june} watts of power.

If Allyn is charged an electricity bill of twenty cents per power watt used, in June she will pay {total_watts_in_june}*${cost_per_watt_cents} = $<<{total_watts_in_june}*{cost_per_watt_cents}={total_monthly_expenses}>>{total_monthly_expenses}
